name: Kanniyakumari beach
description: The Vivekananda rock memeorial, built in memory of Swami Vivekananda the great social reformer is located on a large rock a little away from the shore. It is reached by a ferry service. A meditation hall is also available for those wishing to engage in silent contemplation.
A noval grander carved out of a hoary tradition. That is the 133 feet high granite statue of Thiruvalluvar that has come up in mid- sea off the shore of Kanniyakumari.

This is India's lan's End, the tip of peninular india where the Bay of Bengal, the Indian Ocean and the Arabian Sea meet. Thriveni Sangamam is the union of these three places, where they meet and merge. Kanniyakumari otherwise popularly known as cape Comorinis supposed to be famous pilgrim centre and a beach resort. The unique feature of Kanniyakumari is view of Sunrise and the Sunset where lot of tourists assembles at theshore to witness this breathtaking sight.
